org.gearvrf

Class GVRTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRTransform
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class GVRTransform
extends GVRHybridObject
    One of the key GVRF classes: Encapsulates a 4x4 matrix that controls how GL draws a mesh. Every scene object has a GVRTransform which exposes more-or-less convenient methods to do translation, rotation and scaling. Rotations can be made in either quaternion or angle/axis terms; rotation values can be retrieved as either quaternion components or as Euler angles.

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(float w,
                        float x,
                        float y,
                        float z)
        Set rotation, as a quaternion. Sets the transform's current rotation in quaternion terms. Overrides any previous rotations using rotate(), rotateByAxis() , or rotateByAxisWithPivot() .
        Parameters:
        w - 'W' component of the quaternion.
        x - 'X' component of the quaternion.
        y - 'Y' component of the quaternion.
        z - 'Z' component of the quaternion.

        public float[] getModelMatrix()
        Get the 4x4 single matrix.
        Returns:

      • setModelMatrix

        public void setModelMatrix(float[] mat)
        Set the 4x4 model matrix and set current scaling, rotation, and transformation based on this model matrix.
        Parameters:
        mat - An array of 16 floats representing a 4x4 matrix in OpenGL-compatible column-major format.

      • translate

        public void translate(float x,
                      float y,
                      float z)
        Move the object, relative to its current position. Modify the tranform's current translation by applying translations on all 3 axes.
        Parameters:
        x - 'X' delta
        y - 'Y' delta
        z - 'Z' delta

      • setRotationByAxis

        public void setRotationByAxis(float angle,
                              float x,
                              float y,
                              float z)
        Sets the absolute rotation in angle/axis terms. Rotates using the right hand rule.

        Contrast this with rotate(), rotateByAxis(), or rotateByAxisWithPivot(), which all do relative rotations.

        Parameters:
        angle - Angle of rotation in degrees.
        x - 'X' component of the axis.
        y - 'Y' component of the axis.
        z - 'Z' component of the axis.

      • rotate

        public void rotate(float w,
                   float x,
                   float y,
                   float z)
        Modify the tranform's current rotation in quaternion terms.
        Parameters:
        w - 'W' component of the quaternion.
        x - 'X' component of the quaternion.
        y - 'Y' component of the quaternion.
        z - 'Z' component of the quaternion.

      • rotateByAxis

        public void rotateByAxis(float angle,
                         float x,
                         float y,
                         float z)
        Modify the transform's current rotation in angle/axis terms.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle of rotation in degrees.
        x - 'X' component of the axis.

        z - 'Z' component of the axis.

      • rotateByAxisWithPivot

        public void rotateByAxisWithPivot(float angle,
                                  float axisX,
                                  float axisY,
                                  float axisZ,
                                  float pivotX,
                                  float pivotY,
                                  float pivotZ)
        Modify the transform's current rotation in angle/axis terms, around a pivot other than the origin.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle of rotation in degrees.
        axisX - 'X' component of the axis.
        axisY - 'Y' component of the axis.
        axisZ - 'Z' component of the axis.
        pivotX - 'X' component of the pivot's location.
        pivotY - 'Y' component of the pivot's location.
        pivotZ - 'Z' component of the pivot's location.

        Returns:
